attributes.action: scrap Dispersal Orders from the Anti Social behaviour act
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Dispersal Orders, specified in section 30 of the Anti Social Behaviour Act 2003, allow the police to order someone to leave a designated area for very little reason.  It is not right that someone can be forced to move on just because someone else is scared of them. Any "Anti Social Behaviour" is covered by existing laws against theft, vandalism and violence and these laws are sufficient to solve the problem.
